biography.summary: Amy Jean Klobuchar is a United States Senator from Minnesota, first elected in 2006 and taking office in 2007. A member of the Democratic Party, she has focused on issues including antitrust enforcement, healthcare, infrastructure, and elections reform. She has chaired the Senate Democratic Steering Committee since 2019.
biography.early_life: Born May 25, 1960, in Plymouth, Minnesota. She earned a B.A. in history from Yale University and a J.D. from the University of Chicago Law School. She worked as a corporate lawyer and later served as Hennepin County Attorney before her U.S. Senate tenure.
biography.education: B.A. Yale University (1982); J.D., University of Chicago Law School (1985).
biography.career: Attorney and prosecutor; served as Hennepin County Attorney (1999–2007); elected to the U.S. Senate in 2006 and took office in 2007. Has held leadership roles including Chair of the Senate Democratic Steering Committee.

contact.office_address: 425 Dirksen Senate Office Building Washington DC 20510

policy_positions.stance: Supports strengthening the Affordable Care Act and expanding access to care.
Advocates for robust antitrust enforcement to promote competition.

timeline.event: Elected to U.S. Senate representing Minnesota; took office January 3, 2007.
Became Chair of the Senate Democratic Steering Committee (leadership role).
Continues as Senior Senator from Minnesota; term through 2031.
